bioghist.p: The Independent Christian Association of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania was a "Christian association of liberal character." The group was formed in 1877 and held their first meeting in the First Independent Christian Church in Marlborough. Subsequent meetings were held in other locations. The Reverend J.G. Wilson was chairman of the association, and Professor R.D. Pease, of the Wagner Institute, was its secretary.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a minute book for weekly meetings of the Independent Christian Association between December 1877 and April 1878. The volume also includes the association's constitution and bylaws and a list of members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
